sentences: Leon Everette Baughman (born June 21, 1948) is an American country music artist.
He was born in Aiken, South Carolina, United States.
Between 1977 and 1985, Everette recorded eight studio albums, including five for the RCA Nashville label.

Everette reached top 10 on the Hot Country Songs charts with the singles "Over", "Giving Up Easy", "Hurricane", "Midnight Rodeo", "Just Give Me What You Think Is Fair", "Soul Searchin'", "My Lady Loves Me (Just as I Am)" and "I Could'a Had You".
